basics.name: Jayden Francoise
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the College of Natural Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2027.

work.summary: Summer intern as part of the 2023 STEMworks Internship program
highlights: Shadowed techs on-site to install fiber-optic internet systems and Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) phones.
Modernized critical infrastructure of electrical equipment by repurposing legacy electrical equipment for database usage.

work.summary: Worked as a chef as a part of a class curriculum where we were required to work during real service.
highlights: Collaborated with my team to act as a functioning restaurant to provide catering services to the local community
Collaborated with other chefs to develop menu items for events and caterings.
Provided customer service and interacted with guests to ensure an enjoyable experience

volunteer.organization: Hawaii Okinawan Festival 2022, Leilehua High School Nakayoshi Kai
volunteer.summary: Helped run a booth selling food and snacks to festival goers
highlights: Prepared and managed a customer snack booth, ensuring guests feel welcomed and accustomed to the festival.

volunteer.summary: Worked as an audio technician in video village for film production
highlights: Worked behind the scenes to set up cameras, direct crew for camera shots, and ensure that the graduation live production was smooth.
Managed live audio feeds to ensure proper audio quality.

awards.title: Hawaii State Seal of Biliteracy
awards.summary: Awarded to students who demonstrate a high proficiency in both of the state's two official languages (English and Hawaiian) OR either of the state's two official languages and at least one additional language, including American Sign Language.

awards.title: NASP Hawaii Archery State Champion
awards.summary: I won first place for all divisions
